```{r}
#| eval: false
# ============================================
# Voronoi Cells
#
# Biology-inspired tessellation that could
# represent cells, or abstract data clustering
# ============================================

library(ggplot2)
library(ggforce)
library(dplyr)

set.seed(2024)

# --- Parameters ---
n_cells <- 80
teal <- "#2dd4bf"
coral <- "#f472b6"
purple <- "#a78bfa"
bg_color <- "#1a1a2e"

# --- Generate cell centers ---
cells <- data.frame(
  x = runif(n_cells, 0, 10),
  y = runif(n_cells, 0, 8),
  # Assign to clusters/types
  type = sample(
    c("A", "B", "C", "D"),
    n_cells,
    replace = TRUE,
    prob = c(0.3, 0.3, 0.25, 0.15)
  ),
  # Random "expression level" for color intensity
  expression = runif(n_cells, 0.3, 1)
)

# --- Create the Voronoi tessellation ---
p <- ggplot(cells, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  # Voronoi cells
  geom_voronoi_tile(
    aes(fill = type, alpha = expression),
    colour = bg_color,
    linewidth = 1.5,
    bound = c(0, 10, 0, 8)
  ) +
  # Cell centers (nuclei)
  geom_point(
    aes(colour = type),
    size = 2,
    alpha = 0.9
  ) +
  # Color schemes
  scale_fill_manual(
    values = c(
      "A" = teal,
      "B" = coral,
      "C" = purple,
      "D" = "#fbbf24"
    )
  ) +
  scale_colour_manual(
    values = c(
      "A" = "#1a1a2e",
      "B" = "#1a1a2e",
      "C" = "#1a1a2e",
      "D" = "#1a1a2e"
    )
  ) +
  scale_alpha_identity() +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = bg_color, colour = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = bg_color, colour = NA),
    legend.position = "none"
  ) +
  coord_fixed(xlim = c(0, 10), ylim = c(0, 8))

ggsave(
  "voronoi_cells.png",
  plot = p,
  width = 12,
  height = 9.6,
  dpi = 300,
  bg = bg_color
)

print(p)
```

```{r}
#| eval: false
# ============================================
# DNA Double Helix Visualization
#
# A stylized DNA helix with your color scheme
# ============================================

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

set_seed <- 123

# --- Parameters ---
n_points <- 200
n_base_pairs <- 30
teal <- "#2dd4bf"
coral <- "#f472b6"
purple <- "#a78bfa"
amber <- "#fbbf24"
bg_color <- "#1a1a2e"

# --- Generate helix coordinates ---
t <- seq(0, 4 * pi, length.out = n_points)

# Two strands of the helix
helix <- data.frame(
  t = rep(t, 2),
  strand = rep(c("A", "B"), each = n_points),
  x = c(
    sin(t), # Strand A
    sin(t + pi) # Strand B (opposite phase)
  ),
  y = c(t, t), # Both go up together
  z = c(
    cos(t), # For depth effect
    cos(t + pi)
  )
)

# Adjust x position based on "depth" (z) for 3D effect
helix <- helix %>%
  mutate(
    x_adj = x * (1 + z * 0.2), # Slight perspective
    size = (z + 1.5) / 2.5, # Size based on depth
    alpha = (z + 1.5) / 2.5 # Alpha based on depth
  )

# --- Generate base pairs (rungs of the ladder) ---
base_pair_positions <- seq(0, 4 * pi, length.out = n_base_pairs)

base_pairs <- data.frame(
  t = base_pair_positions,
  x_start = sin(base_pair_positions),
  x_end = sin(base_pair_positions + pi),
  y = base_pair_positions,
  z = cos(base_pair_positions),
  # Random base pair types for color
  base = sample(c("AT", "TA", "GC", "CG"), n_base_pairs, replace = TRUE)
)

base_pairs <- base_pairs %>%
  mutate(
    x_start_adj = x_start * (1 + z * 0.2),
    x_end_adj = x_end * (1 + z * 0.2),
    alpha = (z + 1.5) / 2.5
  )

# --- Create the plot ---
p <- ggplot() +
  # Base pairs (rungs) - draw behind the helix strands
  geom_segment(
    data = base_pairs %>% filter(z < 0), # Back rungs first
    aes(
      x = x_start_adj,
      xend = x_end_adj,
      y = y,
      yend = y,
      colour = base,
      alpha = alpha
    ),
    linewidth = 1.5
  ) +
  # Helix strands (back parts)
  geom_path(
    data = helix %>% filter(z < 0),
    aes(x = x_adj, y = y, group = strand, alpha = alpha),
    colour = "white",
    linewidth = 2
  ) +
  # Base pairs (front rungs)
  geom_segment(
    data = base_pairs %>% filter(z >= 0),
    aes(
      x = x_start_adj,
      xend = x_end_adj,
      y = y,
      yend = y,
      colour = base,
      alpha = alpha
    ),
    linewidth = 2
  ) +
  # Helix strands (front parts)
  geom_path(
    data = helix %>% filter(z >= 0),
    aes(x = x_adj, y = y, group = strand, alpha = alpha),
    colour = "white",
    linewidth = 3
  ) +
  # Base pair colors
  scale_colour_manual(
    values = c(
      "AT" = teal,
      "TA" = coral,
      "GC" = purple,
      "CG" = amber
    )
  ) +
  scale_alpha_identity() +
  # Clean up
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = bg_color, colour = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = bg_color, colour = NA),
    legend.position = "none"
  ) +
  coord_fixed(ratio = 0.5)

ggsave(
  "images/dna_helix.png",
  plot = p,
  width = 6,
  height = 8,
  dpi = 300,
  bg = bg_color
)

print(p)
```
